marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content: 1. The Constitutional Court on Thursday (26/6) decided to separate the organization of national elections and local elections. With this decision, future elections will be held in two stages. The national election to choose members of the DPR, DPD, as well as the president and vice-president will be held first. After a gap of 2 to 2.5 years, the local election will be held to choose members of the DPRD, governors, and regents and mayors. 2. Reuters reported that the Indonesian government will relax import restrictions and regulations, including the removal of import licence requirements for certain goods and the exemption of several industrial raw materials from the import restriction list. Reuters noted that although government officials did not explicitly link this plan to the tariff negotiations with the United States, the discussion appears ahead of the US-Indonesia tariff negotiation deadline on 9 July 2025. The import facilitation will affect ten commodity groups, including fertilizer products, forestry products, and plastics, and is planned to take effect within two months. 3. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said that the Indonesian government has offered the United States an opportunity to invest in critical mineral projects as part of the tariff negotiations. Airlangga mentioned that BPI Danantara will also be involved in the offered projects. 4. Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia claimed that the Cepu oil block recorded an additional oil production of 30,000 barrels per day, reaching 180,000 barrels per day. The government targets total oil lifting in 2025 to reach 605,000 barrels per day, although the actual production during the first five months of 2025 (5M25) was 567,900 barrels per day (versus 579,700 barrels per day in 2024). 5. The Financial Services Authority (OJK) officially postponed the implementation of the co-payment policy on health insurance products, which had been scheduled to take effect on 1 January 2026. The decision was taken following a joint meeting with Commission XI of the House of Representatives on Monday (30/6).

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
The following items were highlighted as other hot topics:
1. The Constitutional Court on Thursday (26/6) decided to separate the organization of national elections and local elections. With this decision, future elections will be held in two stages. The national election to choose members of the DPR, DPD, as well as the president and vice-president will be held first. After a gap of 2 to 2.5 years, the local election will be held to choose members of the DPRD, governors, and regents and mayors.
2. Reuters reported that the Indonesian government will relax import restrictions and regulations, including the removal of import licence requirements for certain goods and the exemption of several industrial raw materials from the import restriction list. Reuters noted that although government officials did not explicitly link this plan to the tariff negotiations with the United States, the discussion appears ahead of the US-Indonesia tariff negotiation deadline on 9 July 2025. The import facilitation will affect ten commodity groups, including fertilizer products, forestry products, and plastics, and is planned to take effect within two months.
3. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said that the Indonesian government has offered the United States an opportunity to invest in critical mineral projects as part of the tariff negotiations. Airlangga mentioned that BPI Danantara will also be involved in the offered projects.
4. Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia claimed that the Cepu oil block recorded an additional oil production of 30,000 barrels per day, reaching 180,000 barrels per day. The government targets total oil lifting in 2025 to reach 605,000 barrels per day, although the actual production during the first five months of 2025 (5M25) was 567,900 barrels per day (versus 579,700 barrels per day in 2024).
5. The Financial Services Authority (OJK) officially postponed the implementation of the co-payment policy on health insurance products, which had been scheduled to take effect on 1 January 2026. The decision was taken following a joint meeting with Commission XI of the House of Representatives on Monday (30/6).

tickerNews.title: BBRI 5M25: Net Profit Bank Only Down 15% YoY
tickerNews.content:
Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) recorded net profit for bank-only operations of 3.6 trillion rupiah in May 2025 (down 11% year-over-year, down 7% month-over-month). This result makes the net profit for bank-only over the five months to May 2025 (5M25) equal to 18.6 trillion rupiah (down 15% YoY), which is lower than the consensus expectation that projected consolidated net profit for 2025F to fall 3% YoY.

Net Interest Income (NII) fell slightly by 1% YoY during 5M25. This improvement compared with the 3M25 realization at a -5% YoY level, driven by improvements in both Interest Income and Interest Expense. Both were relatively flat (-1% YoY) during 5M25, compared with the 3M25 realization that fell around 3-4% YoY. The improvement in Interest Income trend occurred together with credit growth that reached +5% YoY in May 2025, compared with +4% YoY in March 2025, although still below the management's consolidated 2025 target of +7-9% (after adjustment for bank-only versus consolidated).

Net Interest Margin (NIM) remained weak in May 2025 at 6.17%, so the NIM for 5M25 was at 6.38% (versus 6.48% in 5M24), which we assess as still in line with the management's consolidated 2025 target (after adjustment for bank-only versus consolidated).

Non-Interest Income (Non-II) and Provisions Worsened
The improving NII trend was not reflected in Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP), which fell 9% YoY during 5M25, compared with a 6% YoY decline in 3M25. This was caused by weakening Non-Interest Income in April-May 2025. Non-II in the last two months reached only 3.8 trillion rupiah and 3.6 trillion rupiah, smaller than the January-March 2025 level of around 4.1-4.2 trillion rupiah per month, due to lower trading gains and other income.

Meanwhile, provision expenses and Cost of Credit (CoC) rose to 3.4 trillion rupiah and 3.24% in May 2025, marking a second consecutive month increase since March 2025. This realization made provision expenses for 5M25 total 17.7 trillion rupiah (down 1% YoY), with CoC at 3.46%, which we assess as still above the management's consolidated 2025 target range of 3-3.2% (after adjustment for bank-only versus consolidated).

Key Takeaway
We assess BBRI's net profit performance relative to consensus expectations requires a significant recovery in the second half of 2025, although we still see potential for further downward revision of the 2025F net profit estimate from consensus after the recent 2-12% cuts in the last three to six months. From a valuation perspective, BBRI trades at 1.7x 1-Year Forward P/BV on Monday (30/6), almost reaching -2 standard deviations (1.6x) below the five-year historical average. We also see BBRI offering a potential dividend yield minimum of 7.5%.

tickerNews.title: NCKL Increases Ownership in HPAL Smelter to 40%
tickerNews.content: Trimegah Bangun Persada (NCKL) purchased a 20% stake in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt from the company's controlling shareholder, PT Harita Jayaraya, for a value of 4.2 trillion rupiah. NCKL stated that the transaction was carried out because the company sees promising business development potential in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt. After the transaction, NCKL's ownership in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt increased from 20% to 40%, while the remaining 60% is owned by Lygend New Power (Hong Kong) Limited. PT Obi Nickel Cobalt itself is an HPAL smelter with three mixed hydroxide precipitate production lines, having an installed capacity of 65,000 tons of nickel content and 7,500 tons of cobalt content per year.

tickerNews.title: FILM Plans Rights Issue of Approximately 989.8 Million New Shares
tickerNews.content: MD Entertainment (FILM) plans to conduct a rights issue of approximately 989.8 million new shares at an execution price of 800 rupiah per share, with a ratio of 10:1, resulting in a dilution effect of up to 9.09%. The potential proceeds from this corporate action amount to roughly 791.8 billion rupiah, which will be used to pay principal debt to Bank Mandiri (BMRI) and for working capital. PT Samuel International and PT Samuel Sekuritas Indonesia will act as standby purchasers. PT MD Corp Enterprises, the controlling shareholder of FILM, will transfer all its rights to Manoj Dhamoo Punjabi and the South Korean media company SBS Co. Ltd. After the rights issue, SBS Co. Ltd., as the new investor, will hold 3.8% of FILM shares. The rights trading period will run from 10 to 18 July 2025.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Joint Venture Breaks Ground on Integrated EV Battery Plant in Karawang
tickerNews.content: A joint venture owned by Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd., Indonesia Battery Corp., and Aneka Tambang (ANTM) on Sunday (29/6) conducted a groundbreaking ceremony for an integrated electric-vehicle battery plant in Karawang, West Java. Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said that the plant, valued at 6 billion US dollars, will produce battery cells with a capacity of up to 15 GWh, capable of supplying electricity for 250,000-300,000 cars. The initial construction phase of the project is targeted to be completed by the end of 2026, with an initial capacity of 6.9 GWh.

tickerNews.title: DATA Subject to Mandatory Tender Offer for Up to 20% of Shares
tickerNews.content: The new controller Remala Abadi, also a subsidiary of Sarana Menara Nusantara (TOWR), PT Iforte Solusi Infotek, plans to conduct a mandatory tender offer for up to approximately 275 million (20%) shares of DATA at an offer price of 974 rupiah per share during the period 1-30 July 2025. This tender offer follows PT Iforte Solusi Infotek's acquisition of a 40% stake in DATA at a price of 974 rupiah per share, amounting to a total of 535.7 billion rupiah in April 2025.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Shares Purchased by Director Hasmoro
tickerNews.content: The controller and President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Hasmoro, purchased approximately 1.5 million shares of HEAL at a price of 1,365 rupiah per share on 20 June 2025. The total transaction value reached about 2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Hasmoro's direct ownership in HEAL increased from approximately 4.8% to about 4.81%.

tickerNews.title: CDIA: Ample Cash, Inorganic Expansion Reasonable
tickerNews.content: "Inorganic expansion makes sense because infrastructure projects are generally not financed 100% with cash, and the last two companies of Prajogo Pangestu (CUAN & BREN) acquired companies after IPO," said TheodorusMelvin.
